metadata.title: CVE-2023-51043 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.4.5, drivers/gpu/drm/drm_atomic.c has ause-after-free during a race condition between a nonblocking atomic commitand a driver unload.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51043` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-253.287
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-253.287
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-253.287
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1131.141
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1168.183
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1167.180~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1176.191~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1161.178~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1130.141~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-253.287').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.141').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1168.183').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1167.180~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1176.191~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1161.178~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1130.141~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
